acknowledgments.summary: Gjoko Kristic of Zero Science Lab reported this vulnerability to Johnson Controls.

notes.title: Legal Notice

notes.text: Successful exploitation of this vulnerability could allow an unauthenticated user to elevate their privileges.
notes.title: Risk evaluation

notes.text: CISA recommends users take the following measures to protect themselves from social engineering attacks:
notes.title: Recommended Practices

notes.text: CISA reminds organizations to perform proper impact analysis and risk assessment prior to deploying defensive measures.
notes.title: Recommended Practices

notes.text: CISA also provides a section for control systems security recommended practices on the ICS webpage on us-cert.gov. Several recommended practices are available for reading and download, including Improving Industrial Control Systems Cybersecurity with Defense-in-Depth Strategies.
notes.title: Recommended Practices

notes.text: Organizations observing any suspected malicious activity should follow their established internal procedures and report their findings to CISA for tracking and correlation against other incidents.
notes.title: Recommended Practices

references.summary: ICS Advisory ICSA-19-199-01 - Web Scraped Version

branches.name: This vulnerability impacts exacqVision server Versions 9.6 and 9.8

product.name: exacqVision Server - This vulnerability impacts exacqVision server Versions 9.6 and 9.8

branches.name: Exacq Technologies, Inc., a subsidiary of Johnson Controls

notes.text: Some services have an unquoted service path. If an authenticated user is able to insert code in the system root path, that code can be executed during the application startup.CVE-2019-7590 has been assigned to this vulnerability. A CVSS v3 base score of 6.7 has been calculated; the CVSS vector string is (AV:L/AC:H/PR:L/UI:R/S:U/C:H/I:H/A:H).
notes.title: Vulnerability Summary

remediations.details: For questions concerning this product, contact Johnson Controls Global Product Security; email: productsecurity@jci.com.

Additional mitigation guidance and recommended practices are publicly available on the ICS webpage on us-cert.gov in the Technical Information Paper, ICS-TIP-12-146-01B--Targeted Cyber Intrusion Detection and Mitigation Strategies.
